title: Georgia - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: On 5 February 2021, locals organized a protest in Tbilisi and demanded the resignation of the district head, claiming that he reportadly attacked a civilian back in 2017 and didn't get punishment for that. Georgian Labour Party joined the protest. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, family members and friends of the Georgian man who had been convicted in South Ossetia closed the highway near village Aghaiani in Kaspi. They demanded the government to take action to free the man. [size=no report]
On 5 February 2021, activists organized a protest in Tbilisi, and demanded from the government to act to free a man, who had been convicted in South Ossetia. [size=no report]
On 4 February 2021, war veterans organized a protest and demanded increased allowances in Tbilisi. [size=no report]

On 4 February 2021, opposition parties including United National Movement organized a protest in Batumi, demanding the resignation of the Adjara Government head, blaiming him in the falsification of the recent parliamentary elections results. [size=no report]

On 4 February 2021, up to 100 rugby players organized a protest in Tbilisi and demanded that the public registry registers the Rugby Federation's elected head. Protesters claimed that political motivs had halted the registration. [size=up to 100]
On 4 February 2021, activists organized a protest in Tbilisi and demanded to lift the fines for violating coronavirus restrictions. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, protesters demanded the resignation of the prosecutor general and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man who had been killed by police in detention in Tskhinvali. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=up to no report]

On 3 February 2021, activists and unspecified opposition parties protested the construction of a 16-storey hotel instead of the initially announced four-storey building in Batumi boulevard. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, Georgian March organized a demonstration in front of the Presidential palace in Tbilisi. The demonstrators condemned the statements made by the president about the Davit Gareji monastery. A brawl started when the demonstrators attempted to put a lock on the gates, but the police stopped them. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, unspecified opposition representatives and activists organized a demonstration in Chkhorotsku, and attempted to enter the city hall building. A brawl started after the police stopped them. The demonstrators were angered by the alleged forcing of schoolchildren to clean the city hall toilets. [size=no report]
On 2 February 2021, Georgia Labour Party organized a protest in Tbilisi against the frequent jailing of party members. [size=no report]

On 2 February 2021, the European Georgia youth branch organized a protest in Tbilisi. They protested against the Citizens party , which decided to enter the Parliament despite the opposition boycott. [size=no report]
On 2 February 2021, Movement for People organized a protest in Tbilisi against schoolchildren allegedly having been forced to clean the city hall toilets in Chkhorotsku. [size=no report]
On 2 February 2021, activists organized a protest in Tbilisi and demanded that the coronavirus restrictions be lifted. [size=no report]

On 1 February 2021, activists organized a demonstration in Chkhorotsku after an aledged news, that schoolchildren forced to clean the city hall toilets. The demonstrators attempted to enter the city hall building, but the police stopped them. [size=no report]
On 1 February 2021, traders organized a protest in Batumi against the coronavirus restrictions. They demanded the right to resume trade. [size=no report]
On 1 February 2021, activists organized a protest in Batumi against the illegal harvesting of inertial mass in local rivers. [size=no report]
On 1 February 2021, students organized a protest in Tbilisi demanding the reduction of tuition fees and to reinstate students who had to suspend studies due to the coronavirus. [size=no report]

On 1 February 2021, a fight took place in Sukhumi between the residents of village Tamish and the leader of the Aidgylara movement, due to the latter's controversial statements about the touristic facilities being constructed in Tamish. [size=no report]
On 1 February 2021, activists organized a protest in Tbilisi against the Namokhvani hydropower plant construction claiming its harmful influence on the environment. [size=no report]

On 31 January 2021, up to 30 protesters demanded the resignation of the prosecutor general and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man who was killed by police in detention in Tskhinvali. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=up to 30]
On 31 January 2021, 30 citizens of Russia living in Georgia organized a protest in Tbilisi against political persecution in Russia. [size=30]
On 31 January 2021, unspecified opposition parties organized a protest in Kutaisi and demanded that coronavirus restrictions be lifted. [size=no report]

On 31 January 2021, locals and Movement for People organized a protest in Lisi, Mtskheta municipality. The protesters demanded to solve the issue of running water and sewage system in the village. [size=no report]
On 31 January 2021, activists organized two rallies in Tbilisi and demanded to lift the coronavirus restrictions. [size=no report]
On 31 January 2021, residents of Akhalkalaki organized a protest against the coronavirus restrictions. They demanded opening the borders with Russia and Armenia. [size=no report]
On 31 January 2021, locals organized a protest in Namokhvani, Tskaltubo municipality against the construction of a hydro power plant for environment reasons. [size=no report]
On 30 January 2021, business representatives organized a protest in Tbilisi and demanded to lift the coronavirus restrictions. [size=no report]
On 30 January 2021, a protest was organized in Batumi against the coronavirus restrictions. [size=no report]

On 30 January 2021, locals in Salibauri Khelvachauri municipality organized a protest. They claimed that the property where they live was not in their ownership demanding from the government to solve this problem. [size=no report]

On 30 January 2021, a car attempted to run into the tent of protesters in Kutaisi. The protesters had been staying in the tent to protest against the results of the recent parliamentary elections. [size=no report]

On 30 January 2021, locals protested against the Namokhvani hydropower plant construction in Zhoneti, Tskaltubo municipality. The police forcibly removed the tent of the protesters. The protest against the construction had been going on for months. [size=no report]
On 29 January 2021, employees of a food delivery company organized a protest in Tbilisi and demanded better working conditions. [size=no report]
On 29 January 2021, Movement for People organized a protest march in Tbilisi against the coronavirus restrictions. [size=no report]
On 28 January 2021, persons with disabilities organized a protest in Tbilisi and demanded increased social allowances. [size=no report]

On 28 January 2021, several dozen short-term contractors of a water distribution company in Tbilisi organized a protest and demanded better working conditions and higher salaries. [size=several dozen]

On 28 January 2021, lawyers, family members, activists and unspecified politicians organized a protest in Tbilisi demanding justice for two cartographers who had been jailed for treason. The protesters claimed that the charges were politically motivated. [size=no report]

On 28 January 2021, traders of open markets in Kutaisi organized a protest and demanded to resume the public transport operation. Public transportation had been banned amid the coronavirus. [size=no report]

On 28 January 2021, fitness club representative organized a protest in Tbilisi and demanded to reopen the clubs. Lelo joined the protest. During the day, two more protests were organized against the coronavirus restrictions, one by European Georgia youth branch, and another by activists. [size=no report]
On 27 January 2021, activists put up a tent in Kutaisi and demanded extraordinary Parliamentary elections. Unspecified politicians joined the protest. [size=no report]

On 27 January 2021, activists and unspecified politicians organized a protest in Tbilisi. They demanded to reduce the tuition fee by half for students who had to suspend studies due to lack of funds. [size=no report]

On 26 January 2021, business representatives and unspecified opposition politicians organized a protest in Tbilisi and demanded that coronavirus restrictions be lifted. The government had prolonged some restrictions a few days earlier. [size=no report]
On 26 January 2021, locals organized a protest in Ozurgeti City against a local factory's operation. They claimed that the factory was a health hazard to the population. [size=no report]
On 26 January 2021, up to 40 employees of an American oil company organized a protest in Dedoplis Tskaro and demanded indebted salaries. [size=up to 40]

On 26 January 2021, lawyers and family members of prisoners organized a protest in Kutaisi. They demanded to reduce the prisoners' sentences amid the grave conditions created in prisons by the coronavirus and increasing inmate infections. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, activists organized a protest in Tbilisi and demanded to lift the coronavirus restrictions. Another rally in Tbilisi demanded to restart the work of public transportation. Traders of an open market also organized a protest against restrictions. The government had prolonged some restrictions a few days earlier. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, up to 20 protesters demanded the resignation of the prosecutor general and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man who had been killed by police in detention in Tskhinvali. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=up to 20]
On 25 January 2021, activists organized a protest in Batumi to support their fellow activist, who had been jailed for assaulting a local public official a few days earlier. [size=no report]
ENM: United National Movement; European Georgia; Lelo; Strategy Aghmashenebeli; More Freedom - Girchi; Labour Group (Georgia)

On 24 January 2021, business owners, regular citizens and opposition parties, including United National Movement, European Georgia, Lelo, Strategy Aghmashenebeli and More Freedom-Girchi organized a protest in Tbilisi and demanded lifting coronavirus restrictions. The government had prolonged some restrictions a few days earlier. [size=no report]

On 24 January 2021, up to 20 protesters demanded the resignation of the prosecutor general and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man who had been killed by police in detention in Tskhinvali. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=up to 20]

On 24 January 2021, United National Movement, Lelo and activists organized a protest in Batumi and demanded the release of an activist who had been arrested for assaulting a local public official. [size=no report]
SLP: Georgian Labour Party; Labour Group (Georgia)

On 23 January 2021, Georgian Labour Party organized a protest in Tbilisi and demanded to lift coronavirus restrictions. The government had prolonged some restrictions a few days earlier. A similar protest was organized by traders of an open market who demanded the right to resume trading. [size=no report]

On 23 January 2021, activists protested the construction of a multistory hotel in Batumi boulevard. They claimed that the boulevard was cultural heritage and high building should not be constructed there. [size=no report]

On 23 January 2021, United National Movement rallied against a local politician in Batumi, who had decided to enter the Ajara High Council despite an opposition boycott. One of the demonstrators attacked the politician and emptied a trash bin on him. Police interfered to protect the politician from demonstrators. [size=no report]

On 23 January 2021, staff and members of a fitness club in Batumi organized a protest and demanded that the fitness clubs are reopened. Gyms had been closed down amid the coronavirus. [size=no report]
On 23 January 2021, activists organized a protest in Anaklia, Zugdidi municipality. They claimed that the construction of Anaklia port was suspended amid Russian involvement. [size=no report]
On 23 January 2021, activists organized a protest in Tbilisi to support a jailed owner of a private TV station. The protesters believe that he was a political prisoner. [size=no report]
On 23 January 2021, a protest was organized in Tbilisi against the arrest of Alexey Navalny in Russia. [size=no report]
On 22 January 2021, activists organized a protest in Kutaisi, demanding the release of the political prisoners and organisation of snap parliamentary elections. [size=no report]
On 22 January 2021, activists organized a protest in Telavi, demanding from the prosecution to investigate an attack on them, when a car ran into the tent of the protesters. [size=no report]

On 22 January 2021, up to 30 protesters demanded the resignation of the prosecutor general and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man who had been killed by police in detention in Tskhinvali. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. Unnamed opposition politicians were also present at the rally. [size=up to 30]

On 22 January 2021, activists organized a protest in Batumi, and demanded from the Georgian president to apologize to the Georgian soldiers for her statements about the August 2008 war, claiming that she blamed Georgia and encouraged Russia to avoid responsibility for the war. [size=no report]

On 21 January 2021, activists and the youth branch of European Georgia organized a protest in Poti demanding the release of political prisoners and organisation of snap parliamentary elections. [size=no report]
On 21 January 2021, the youth branch of European Georgia organized a protest in Zugdidi, demanding the release of political prisoners. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2021, about 10 protesters demanded the resignation of the prosecutor general and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man who had been killed by police in detention in Tskhinvali. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=about 10]

On 20 January 2021, activists and politicians, including the United National Movement, organized a protest in Tbilisi to support two jailed cartographers. The protesters claimed that the charges were politically motivated. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2021, activists put up a tent in Zugdidi to protest the results of recent parliamentary elections. The police tried to arrest some of the protesters; however, they did not arrest anyone after a protester felt bad during the arrest. [size=no report]

On 19 January 2021, 30 to 40 protesters demanded the resignation of the prosecutor general and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man who had been killed by police in detention in Tskhinvali. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=30 to 40]

On 18 January 2021, a protest was organized in Tsqaltubo municipality to support the construction of the Namokhvani hydropower plant. They demanded to continue the construction despite the protests against it claiming that the plant would give economic opportunities to the region. [size=no report]
On 17 January 2021, activists organized a protest in Telavi demanding from the police to investigate the case of a car that ran into the tent of protesters. [size=no report]

On 16 January 2021, a protest was organized in Opurchkheti village in Tskaltubo municipality to support the construction of the Namokhvani hydropower plant. They demanded to continue the construction despite the protests against it claiming that the plant would give economic opportunities to the region. [size=no report]

On 16 January 2021, activists organized a protest in Zhoneti, Tskaltubo municipality against the construction of Namokhvani hydropower plant claiming that the plant would ruin the environment. The protests against the construction of the hydropower plant were taking place for months. [size=no report]

On 16 January 2021, unspecified opposition parties organized a protest in Batumi claiming that the Georgian Dream leader Bidzina Ivanishvili did not leave politics, and his statement about leaving was a lie. [size=no report]

On 16 January 2021, protesters demanded the resignation of the prosecutor general and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man who had been killed by police in detention in Tskhinvali. Former presidents of South Ossetian and other politicians met with the protesters and promised to be mediators between the protesters and the de facto government. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=no report]

On 16 January 2021, activists organized a protest in Tbilisi during the congress of Georgian Dream party against the results of the recent parliamentary elections and blamed the ruling party members in electoral fraud. The police arrested dozens of protesters after they tried to put a banner and light smoke bombs. [size=no report]

On 15 January 2021, up to 20 protesters demanded the resignation of the prosecutor general and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man who had been killed by police in detention in Tskhinvali. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=up to 20]
On 15 January 2021, drivers of trailers organized a protest in Poti and demanded increased tariffs for cargo transportation. [size=no report]

On 14 January 2021, Muslim population living in village Buknari of Chokhatauri municipality organized a protest and demanded the right to pray. A few days earlier Muslim and Christian groups clashed in Buknari over the issue of the place for prayer. [size=no report]
On 14 January 2021, activists protested the result of the recent Parliamentary elections in tents set up in front of the parliament building in Tbilisi. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2021, a Muslim group held a demonstration in Buknari village of Chokhatauri municipality demanding their right to congregate and pray free. A brawl with policemen started after the Muslim group's representatives attempted to break the police cordon separating them from another demonstrations organized by Christian groups. The local Christians were against the alleged construction of the mosque in the region. A few days earlier, Muslim and Christian groups in Buknari had clashed over the place for Muslim prayers. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2021, the Christian group held a protest in Buknari village of Chokhatauri municipality against the alleged construction of the mosque in the region. A Muslim group also demonstrated at the same time for their rights to congregate, as police forces stood between two groups. A few days earlier, Muslim and Christian groups in Buknari had clashed over the place for Muslim prayers. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2021, Movement for People organized a protest in Tbilisi over the issue of the students with suspended student status. They demanded to reinstate the students' status and reduce the tuition fee by half. The protesters condemned the passivity of the Parliament over the issue. [size=no report]

On 12 January 2021, locals organized a protest in Khelvachauri to support a man jailed for arms possession. The protesters claimed that the police had planted the gun on him. Police arrested three protesters for disobedience. [size=no report]
On 12 January 2021, farmers organized a protest in Kobuleti. They claimed that their tangerines were going rot and demanded from the government to help them in selling the citrus. [size=no report]

On 12 January 2021, a brawl took place between Christians and Muslims in Buknari village of Chokhatauri municipality after the local Christians demonstrated against the Muslim prayers in the village. Two people were injured. [size=no report]
On 11 January 2021, a protest was organized in Poti against the smell of the fish spreading from the fish processing plant. [size=no report]

On 11 January 2021, activists, politicians and lawyers including Shemakhe Amnestia and Lelo organized a protest in Tbilisi and demanded changes to the Amnesty Law. The protesters demanded to release more prisoners. [size=no report]

On 11 January 2021, protesters demanded the resignation of the prosecutor general and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man who had been killed by police in detention in Tskhinvali. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=no report]
On 11 January 2021, family members of prisoners organized a protest in Batumi. They demanded changes to the new Amnesty Law, and amnesty for more prisoners. [size=no report]
On 11 January 2021, road rehabilitation workers organized a protest in Poti and demanded payment for the completed work. [size=no report]

On 11 January 2021, Movement for People organized a protest in Tbilisi over the issue of the students with suspended student status. They demanded to reinstate the students' status and reduce the tuition fee by half. The protesters condemned the passivity of the Parliament over the issue. [size=no report]
On 10 January 2021, activists organized a protest in Tbilisi. They claimed that the government was mishandling the coronavirus pandemic and funds. [size=no report]
On 10 January 2021, activists organized a protest in Kutaisi against recent anti-Semitic statements made by an Orthodox priest in the city. [size=no report]
On 10 January 2021, opposition parties, including the United National Movement, organized a protest in Batumi against the results of the recent parliamentary elections. [size=no report]
On 10 January 2021, family members and lawyers of prisoners organized a protest in Kutaisi demanding changes to the new Amnesty Law to release more prisoners. [size=no report]
On 9 January 2021, activists organized a protest in Tbilisi and demanded changes to the new Amnesty Law to cover more prisoners. [size=no report]

On 9 January 2021, locals organized a demonstration in Poti against fish smell in the city. The demonstration moved to the mayor's house, where there was a brawl with the mayor's neighbors. Police arrested four people. [size=no report]
On 8 January 2021, up to 40 locals organized a protest in village Chabukiani in Lagodekhi municipality demanding amnesty for two convicted village residents. [size=up to 40]
On 8 January 2021, locals organized a protest in Duisi village of Akhmeta municipality demanding amnesty for three convicted locals. [size=no report]
On 8 January 2021, activists, politicians and family members organized a protest in Tbilisi demanding political prisoners' release. [size=no report]
On 8 January 2021, lawyers and family members of prisoners organized a protest in Kutaisi and demanded changes to the draft of the amnesty law. [size=no report]

On 7 January 2021, locals staged a demonstration and closed Tbilisi-Rustavi highway over lacking gas supply for several days. A brawl between the demonstrators and police broke out when the latter tried to reopen the highway.[size=no report]
On 6 January 2021, activists organized a protest in Zhoneti village of Tskaltubo municipality against the construction of Namokhvani hydropower plant due to environmental concerns. [size=no report]

On 5 January 2021, several dozen protesters demanded the resignation of the prosecutor general and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man who had been killed by police in detention in Tskhinvali. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=several dozen]

On 5 January 2021, a car hit (assumed on purpose) a protest tent of activists in front of the theatre building in Telavi. Protesters had started a sit-in against election fraud in the recent Parliamentary elections. [size=no report]

On 5 January 2021, around 20 civil activists organized a protest in Tbilisi demanding with the new amnesty law also release the previously detained owner of the opposition channel and two cartographers. [size=around 20]

On 4 January 2021, protesters demanded the resignation of the prosecutor general and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man who had been killed by police in detention in Tskhinvali. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=no report]
On 4 January 2021, employees of an American company organized a protest in Dedoplis Tskaro and demanded belated salaries. [size=no report]

On 4 January 2021, activists organized a protest march throughout the region of Kakheti. They started the protest in Sagarejo, moved to Gurjaani, Kvareli and then concluded the protest in Telavi. The protesters demanded the release of political prisoners and the new Parliamentary elections. [size=no report]

On 2 January 2021, a group of people organized a demonstration in Telavi demanding to investigate the case of 1 January, when unknown person heat the tent of the demonstrators. The police detained 1 demonstrators after the police officers didn't allow them to put tents on the locations. The arrest followed with the brawl between the demonstrators and the police. [size=no report]

On 31 December 2020, protesters demanded the resignation of the prosecutor general and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man who had been killed by police in detention in Tskhinvali. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=no report]
Force Is In Unity; Shemakhe Amnestia

On 30 December 2020, Force Is In Unity organized a protest in Tbilisi and demanded the release of Georgian citizens arrested in South Ossetia and Abkhazia. During the day, Shemakhe Amnestia organized a protest in Tbilisi and demanded large-scale amnesty of prisoners in Georgia. [size=no report]

On 29 December 2020, protesters demanded the resignation of the prosecutor general and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man who had been killed by police in detention in Tskhinvali. Nykhas joined the protest. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=no report]

On 29 December 2020, a protest was organized in Zhoneti village of Tskaltubo municipality to support the Namokhvani hydropower plant's construction. The protesters claimed that previous protests against the plant had halted the construction and left people unemployed. [size=no report]

On 29 December 2020, traders of a street market organized a protest in Batumi and demanded the right to sell their products. The open markets had been closed amid the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]
On 29 December 2020, around 100 employees of the Kutaisi International University organized a protest and demanded belated salaries. [size=around 100]
On 29 December 2020, a protest was organized in Tbilisi against the construction of Oni and Namokhvani hydropower plants due to the possible harm to the environment. [size=no report]
On 28 December 2020, activists organized a protest in Tbilisi against dire social conditions in the country. [size=no report]

On 27 December 2020, traders organized a protest in Tbilisi, after the police banned an open food market due to coronavirus restrictions and forced the traders to leave. The traders attempted to close the road, but the police prevented the attempt and kept the road open. [size=no report]
Non-violent activity: On 26 December 2020, according to Georgian Security Service, Russian Military Forces started the erection of border marks near village Pakhulani in Tsalenjikha municipality.
On 26 December 2020, civil activists protested the country's criminal situation in Tbilisi following the murder of a doctor in Telavi, allegedly committed by a policeman. [size=no report]

On 26 December 2020, traders of an open market in Tbilisi organized a protest and demanded the right to sell their products. Open markets had been closed amid the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 26 December 2020, traders of an open market in Kutaisi organized a protest and demanded the right to sell their products. Open markets had been closed amid the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 25 December 2020, up to 40 protesters demanded the resignation of the prosecutor general and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man who had been killed by police in detention in Tskhinvali. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=up to 40]

On 25 December 2020, traders of a street market organized a protest in Batumi and demanded the rights to sell their products. The open markets had been closed amid the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]
On 25 December 2020, traders of an open market in Tbilisi organized a protest demanding reopening of the market. The market had been closed down amid the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 25 December 2020, several dozen activists organized a protest in Tbilisi against a statement of the Georgian President regarding the creation of a Caucasus platform. They thought that this was an anti-western statement. [size=several dozen]
On 24 December 2020, traders of a street market organized a protest in Batumi and demanded that the markets are reopened. The markets had been closed down because of the coronavirus. [size=no report]

On 24 December 2020, up to 40 traders of an open market in Rustavi organized a protest and demanded the right to resume trading. The open markets had been closed amid the coronavirus pandemic. [size=up to 40]
On 24 December 2020, traders of an open market in Tbilisi organized a protest demanding reopening of the market. The market had been closed down amid the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 24 December 2020, civil activists organized a protest in front of the Parliament in Tbilisi against the new government's appointment claiming that any decision by the incumbent Parliament is illegitimate. [size=no report]

On 24 December 2020, street traders organized a protest in Kutaisi and demanded the right to sell their products. The government had banned open markets and street trading amid the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]
On 24 December 2020, Shemakhe Amnestia organized a protest in Tbilisi and demanded large-scale amnesty of prisoners. [size=no report]

On 23 December 2020, protesters demanded the resignation of the prosecutor general and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man who had been killed by police in detention in Tskhinvali. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=no report]

On 23 December 2020, civil activists organized a protest in front of the Parliament in Tbilisi against the new government's appointment claiming that any decision by the incumbent Parliament is illegitimate. [size=no report]

On 22 December 2020, from 10 to 90 protesters demanded the resignation of the prosecutor general and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man who had been killed by police in detention in Tskhinvali. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=10 to 90]
On 22 December 2020, students who had been suspended from the universities organized a protest in Tbilisi and demanded assistance in paying tuition fees. [size=no report]

On 21 December 2020, from 20 to 75 protesters demanded the resignation of the prosecutor general and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man who had been killed by police in detention in Tskhinvali. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=20 to 75]

On 21 December 2020, civil activists organized a protest in front of the Parliament in Tbilisi. They rallied against the new Parliament claiming that the recent Parliamentary elections had been rigged. The protesters attempted to put stickers on the walls, but the police stoped the protesters and did not allow put stickers. [size=no report]

On 20 December 2020, protesters demanded the resignation of the prosecutor general and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man who had been killed by police in detention in Tskhinvali. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=no report]
On 19 December 2020, activists organized a protest in Tbilisi and demanded the resignation of the Health Minister amid poor performance during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 19 December 2020, residents of village Zemo Shakshaketi in Kareli municipality organized a protest against a nearby hydropower plant. The protesters said that the plant damaged their houses. [size=no report]

On 19 December 2020, 30 to 200 people organized a protest in Tskhinvali demanding the resignation of the Prosecutor General and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man killed by police in detention in August. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=30 to 200]

On 18 December 2020, Movement for People organized a protest in Tbilisi and demanded from the government to help students who had to suspend their studies due to lack of money. The leader of the movement attempted to put the list of such students on the fence at the Parliament, but the police did not allow this. [size=no report]

On 18 December 2020, 30 to 200 people organized a protest in Tskhinvali demanding the resignation of the Prosecutor General and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man killed by police in detention in August. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=30 to 200]

On 17 December 2020, 30 to 200 people organized a demonstration in Tskhinvali demanding the resignation of the Prosecutor General and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man killed by police in detention. There was a brawl between the demonstrators and the police as the demonstrators attempted to put up a tent. The family members of the deceased man started the demonstration on 4 December. [size=30 to 200]

On 17 December 2020, the United National Movement organized a protest in Batumi alongside the sitting of the High Council of Ajara. They had been protesting the results of the recent Parliamentary elections for more than a month. [size=no report]

On 16 December 2020, activists organized a rally in front of Tbilisi City Hall protesting against the demolition of illegal houses in Aprika disctirct. They demanded a meeting with the mayor, but the police did not allow it. Meanwhile, the locals living in Aprika district of the city organized a protest in their own district. [size=no report]

On 16 December 2020, 30 to 200 people organized a protest in Tskhinvali demanding the resignation of the Prosecutor General and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man killed by police in detention in August. A group of activists joined the protest from North Ossetia region of Russia. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=30 to 200]

On 15 December 2020, 30 to 200 people organized a protest in Tskhinvali demanding the resignation of the Prosecutor General and punishment of those responsible for the death of a man killed by police in detention in August. The family of the deceased man started the protest on 4 December. [size=30 to 200]
On 15 December 2020, family members of a man charged with murder organized a protest in Kutaisi, claiming that the court made mistakes in the case. [size=no report]

On 15 December 2020, activists organized a protest in Telavi and demanded a meeting with the mayor due to the recent attempt of unknown people to attack protesters in the tent. The police did not allow them to enter the city hall building. The protesters accused the government of intimidating the activists. [size=no report]
On 15 December 2020, the Georgian Labour Party protested the poverty level in the country with a performance in front of the City Hall of Tbilisi. [size=no report]

On 15 December 2020, activists organized a protest in Batumi against the opening sitting of the High Council since they had been defying the recent Parliamentary election results. They attempted to put some stickers at the building of the High Council of Ajara. The police did not allow this and arrested seven activists. [size=no report]

On 15 December 2020, locals from Aprika district (one of Tbilisi's poorest areas) organized a demonstration in Tbilisi as the city hall demolished illegal houses in the district. 12 were arrested and several injured when demonstrators clashed with the police. [size=no report]
